qas.question: What kind of dogs help people with physical or mental disabilities?
Early warning allows epileptics to get to safety, get medication or what else?

context: <a0_0>Service dogs<a0_0/> such as guide dogs, utility dogs, assistance dogs, hearing dogs, and psychological therapy dogs provide assistance to individuals with physical or mental disabilities. Some dogs owned by epileptics have been shown to alert their handler when the handler shows signs of an impending seizure, sometimes well in advance of onset, allowing the guardian to seek safety, medication, or <a1_0>medical care.
